data.title: FILM: The Adventures of Prince Achmed
data.text:
Join us for a film screening of The Adventures of Prince Achmed by Lotte Reiniger accompanied by a live music soundtrack performed by Chris Davies.

The Adventures of Prince Achmed – Lotte Reiniger’s 1926 silhouette animation is the oldest surviving animated film in the world. The exquisite film – made from card and entirely cut by hand – took three years to complete. Originally created as a silent film, the animation has a new soundtrack composed by musician, Chris Davies.

Come along to watch this beautiful fairytale on the big screen and listen to Chris’ live music accompaniment. The film is a PG certificate and runs for approximately 60 minutes.

Pre-film snacks will include: vegetable samosa, vegetable pakora, pani poori and gulan jamun.
